      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Point3D coords_converter.add​(Point3D gps, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      computes a new point which is the gps point transformed by a 3D vector (in meters)
      Point3D MyCoords.add​(Point3D gps, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)
      In this function we get 2 3D point, one is polar coordinates and the other is cartesian coordinates.
      static Point3D MyCoords.ConvertToGps​(Point3D vector)
      To calculate the radius of the point we the square root of each quadratic point, for the longitude we calculate the arctan of point y divided by the point x, for the latitude we calculate the arctan of the square root of each quadratic point.
      static Point3D MyCoords.ConvertToVector​(Point3D gps)
      Conversion between polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates.

      computes the 3D vector (in meters) between two gps like points
      Point3D MyCoords.vector3D​(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      In this function we calculate the vector in meters.

      return true if this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate: [-180,+180],[-90,+90],[-450, +inf]

      BEHINDB: ן¿½ן¿½ן¿½ן¿½ן¿½a---------bן¿½ן¿½ן¿½ן¿½+ן¿½
